full_summary:
## Advanced Procurement Notice: Neurobehavioral Facility for Blast Injury Assessment (CFB Suffield, Alberta)

### Project Overview

The Department of National Defence (DND) intends to establish a new neurobehavioral facility at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Suffield, Alberta, as part of its ongoing research and development efforts. This advanced procurement notice (APN) is not a bid solicitation, but rather an opportunity for interested bidders to begin the process of obtaining the required security clearance(s) under the Sponsorship Process. Please note that there is no guarantee that the contract will proceed or that any security clearance(s) will be granted.

### Project Description

The proposed neurobehavioral facility will be linked to an existing building and will include research and laboratory space, offices, washrooms, and ancillary services. An MRI room will be located within the building footprint, with all supporting infrastructure provided. The design will consist of a two-story steel frame structure with a total floor area of approximately 1,880 m^2.

### Key Services and Requirements

- Civil Engineering
- Structural Engineering
- Electrical Engineering
- Mechanical Engineering
- Carpentry
- Laboratory Specialties
- Landscaping
- Masonry
- Computer and Communications Wiring

### Sustainability and Energy Requirements

The facility must achieve a minimum of 3 Green Globes and exceed National Energy Code for Buildings by a minimum of 15%.

### Estimated Contract Value

The estimated contract value is approximately $27,000,000.00.

### Security Clearance Requirements

All bidder must hold a valid and active Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). This is conditional on applying for a sponsorship request under the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Defence Construction Canada (DCC).

### Sponsorship Request Process

To begin the sponsorship request process, interested bidders must submit an application through DCC's Website. The application must include the contract number CN81758 and the level of clearance requested. DCC will review the application and communicate directly with the bidder to complete the sponsorship request package. The package will then be forwarded to the CSP, PWGSC for processing.

### Important Dates

- June 2024: Anticipated procurement date
- April 4, 2024: Tender Closing Date
- June 1, 2024: Expected Contract Start Date
- June 1, 2024: Expected Contract End Date
